intro: Dodecatheon dentatum var. ellisiae, commonly known as the Ellisia's toothed glory flower, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its unique floral structure and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in botanical gardens and native plant collections.
